attributes.action: Commission an independent review of the effects of caring, on carers incomes.
attributes.additional_details: In 2008, the Carers Strategy looked to review carers benefits as part of a wider process of welfare reform. Parliamentary Business - Publications & Records, Select Committee on Works and Pensions Fourth Report (3) Carers Incomes and benefits. Neither the last Labour Government, nor any Government since have implemented the recommendations made from that review.
attributes.background: Many Unpaid Carers are reliant on Carers Allowance, in order to help "make ends meet", however with the increasing costs required to fund the needs of caring for people with disabilities, Carers Allowance often does not meet the demand.

rejection.details: Petitions need to call on the UK Government or Parliament to take a specific action. We're not sure whether you would like a new inquiry into carers or whether would like the Government to implement the recommendations from earlier inquiries. You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
